title: Fremantle
summary: Fremantle (/ˈfriːmæntəl/) is a port city in Western Australia, located at the mouth of the Swan River in the metropolitan area of Perth, the state capital. Fremantle Harbour serves as the port of Perth. In 2016, Fremantle had a population of approximately 29,000.[1] The Western Australian vernacular diminutive for Fremantle is Freo.[2]
